p: We found that The antioxidant activity are differed from those previously reported using the hydro-distillated EOs from the Indian C. citriodora with an IC 50 of 425.4 ± 6.79 μg/mL (DPPH) and 87.3 ± 9.27 μg/mL (reduced activity) [ 26]. EO from C. citriodora leaves is rich in monoterpenoids and thus, shows strong antioxidant activity [ 26, 53, 54].
